transportAdvice: Guadalajara has a metro system and an extensive bus network that connect most tourist areas, making public transit a practical and affordable option for getting around. Taxis and ride-hailing vehicles are widely available throughout the city, and the historic center is compact enough to explore comfortably on foot.

weather.description: Cool, dry, and sunny days make January one of the most pleasant months to visit.
Warm afternoons and cool nights continue with very little rainfall expected.
Temperatures begin to climb and conditions remain dry and comfortable.
One of the hottest and driest months, with strong sunshine and warm evenings.
Heat peaks and the first rains of the season begin to appear, bringing some relief.
The rainy season begins in earnest with frequent afternoon and evening thunderstorms.
Heavy rains are common, typically falling in intense afternoon showers with cooler temperatures.
Rainfall remains frequent and humidity is elevated, though mornings are often clear.
The wettest month of the year with persistent rain and overcast skies.
Rains begin to taper off and temperatures become very comfortable for sightseeing.
Dry and mild conditions return, making November an excellent time to visit.
Cool, dry, and festive, with comfortable daytime temperatures and chilly nights.
